articles.title: Kohli surpasses Sangakkara to become second-highest international run-scorer
articles.summary: Virat Kohli became the second highest run-scorer in all forms of international cricket as he helped steer India to a four-wicket win in the first ODI against New Zealand.

articles.title: 'Virat Kohli retired too early; he is a machine': Donald
articles.summary: South African pace legend Allan Donald believes Virat Kohli retired from Test cricket prematurely but is confident the Indian star's exceptional work ethic will see him compete in the 2027 ODI World Cup. Donald also expressed optimism about South Africa's chances in the upcoming T20 World Cup, citing their well-balanced squad and India's challenging batting conditions.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Another milestone! Virat Kohli goes past Sourav Ganguly
articles.summary: Virat Kohli has achieved another milestone, becoming the fifth Indian with the most ODI appearances, surpassing Sourav Ganguly.  With 309 matches played, he now trails only Tendulkar, Dhoni, Dravid, and Azharuddin.  Kohli is also nearing a significant batting record, poised to become the second-highest international run-scorer across all formats.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Torrid Sabres score on first shot, coast to win over Ducks
articles.summary: Jack Quinn scored two goals for the Buffalo Sabres in a 5-3 win over the visiting Anaheim Ducks on Saturday night.,Tage Thompson had a goal and an ass

articles.title: Sri Lanka beat Pakistan as T20 series drawn 1-1 - scorecard
articles.summary: Latest scorecard from the third and final Twenty20 international between Sri Lanka and Pakistan in Dambulla.

articles.title: Hurricanes secure play-off spot despite wash out - BBL scorecard
articles.summary: Latest scorecard from the Big Bash League match between Sydney SIxers and Hobart Hurricanes at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

articles.title: How Virat Kohli's Words Played An Instrumental Role In Jemimah Rodrigues' World Cup Semi-Final Knock
articles.summary: Jemimah Rodrigues (left) and Virat Kohli.

articles.title: Phillips defies physics at point; Kohli can’t believe his eyes - Watch
articles.summary: The moment came in the eighth over of India’s innings. Gill, batting on eight, attempted a cut shot off the fourth ball of Zak Foulkes’ over. The delivery was back of a length and outside the off stump. Gill stayed back and hit the ball hard towards the backward point region. Phillips moved quickly to his left, jumped and stretched out his left hand while airborne.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Dhruv Jurel joins India ODI squad as Rishabh Pant’s replacement
articles.summary: In-form wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel has been drafted into India’s ODI squad as Rishabh Pant’s replacement after the latter was ruled out with a side strain. Jurel joins the team on the back of a prolific Vijay Hazare Trophy campaign, where he has scored 558 runs and led Uttar Pradesh to the top of Elite Group B.
articles.author: Pratyush Raj

articles.title: Kohli makes 93 as India beat New Zealand in first ODI - scorecard
articles.summary: Latest scorecard from the first one-day international between India and New Zealand in Vadodara.

articles.title: IND vs NZ: Bangar calls Hindi ‘national language of India’, faces backlash
articles.summary: Sanjay Bangar sparked controversy during the first IND vs NZ ODI by calling Hindi the “national language of India” on air. The remark, made during a discussion involving KL Rahul and Washington Sundar, drew heavy social media backlash, with fans pointing out that India has no national language. Meanwhile, New Zealand posted 300/8, led by Daryl Mitchell’s 84.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Shubman Gill makes bold call at toss - WATCH
articles.summary: India won the toss and elected to bowl first against New Zealand in the opening ODI, with Rishabh Pant ruled out due to injury and Dhruv Jurel replacing him. Captain Shubman Gill explained the decision was to assess bowling combinations and dew conditions.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: 'Blue, green, red': Jadeja undergoes unique training session - WATCH
articles.summary: Ravindra Jadeja is honing his bowling skills with a unique drill ahead of India's ODI series against New Zealand. Guided by coach Morne Morkel, Jadeja practiced precise ball placement, aiming for coloured cones. The all-rounder is in excellent form, boasting a strong ODI record against the Black Caps, making him a key player for the upcoming matches.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: South Africa Legend Jacques Kallis Delivers Massive Take On Virat Kohli's Retirement
articles.summary: File image of Virat Kohli

articles.title: No. 6 Duke recovers from slow start, defeats No. 24 SMU
articles.summary: Isaiah Evans scored 21 points while hitting clutch second-half 3-pointers as No. 6 Duke fended off short-handed No. 24 SMU for an 82-75 victory Saturd

articles.title: Massive! Rohit scripts history, surpasses Gayle to pocket this record
articles.summary: Rohit Sharma created history in the first ODI against New Zealand by becoming the leading six-hitter among openers in ODI cricket, surpassing Chris Gayle. He also became the first player to hit 650 international sixes. Rohit scored 26 runs, while New Zealand posted 300/8 after a strong start led by their openers.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: India survive late scare; Kohli's 93 anchors four-wicket win over NZ
articles.summary: India were well placed for most of the chase and appeared in control until Kohli’s dismissal in the 40th over. At that stage, India needed 67 runs from 66 balls with seven wickets in hand. However, New Zealand struck back quickly, picking up wickets to put pressure on the hosts.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: What happened to Rishabh Pant? A blow-by-blow account
articles.summary: Rishabh Pant has been ruled out of the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand due to a side strain sustained during training. The wicketkeeper-batter suffered an oblique muscle tear after being hit by a delivery. This setback comes after his return from a toe fracture. Dhruv Jurel has been named as Pant’s replacement.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Record! India's Nandani becomes first player ever to achieve this feat
articles.summary: Nandani Sharma created WPL history with a sensational spell for Delhi Capitals against Gujarat Giants in Navi Mumbai. The Chandigarh pacer became the first player to take a five-wicket haul and a hat-trick in a single WPL match. Her pace and accuracy turned the game, marking her arrival as a rising star in Indian women’s cricket.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Nabi-Eisakhil become first father-son duo to bat together in a top-tier T20 league
articles.summary: The pair batted added 53 off 30 for the fourth wicket with Eisakhil scoring 92 in Noakhali's first win of the BPL

articles.title: 'Agar maar padh bhi jaati': Virat Kohli's powerful message to net bowler goes viral
articles.summary: Virat Kohli's leadership shone during India's training camp as he motivated a local net bowler, emphasising conviction in bowling.  After an intense session, Kohli offered encouragement and signed a ball, demonstrating his commitment to developing talent and his own sharp form ahead of the ODI series.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

'Mini VK'! Virat Kohli meets his childhood lookalike; fans go wild - WATCH
articles.summary: Virat Kohli's preparation for the ODI series against New Zealand in Vadodara was marked by intense net sessions and a heartwarming fan interaction. A young fan's striking resemblance to a younger Kohli drew widespread amusement online, with many dubbing him 'Mini VK'. Kohli continues his impressive ODI form, aiming to maintain momentum against the Blackcaps.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: 4,4,6,6,6,6: Devine intervention at DY Patil; Sophie carnage lights up WPL
articles.summary: Gujarat Giants opener Sophie Devine unleashed a devastating 32-run over against Delhi Capitals' Sneh Rana, propelling her to a rapid half-century. Devine's explosive innings of 95 runs off 42 balls, including six sixes in one over, was the highlight of the match. She narrowly missed a century as Gujarat Giants posted a strong total.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk
